docs.lead_paragraph: POOR Prince. Like many of his breed, this 8-year-old German shepherd has chronic arthritis caused by a hereditary malformation of his hip joints. Prince needs relief from his constant pain, but long-term use of anti-inflammatory drugs such as aspirin, Tylenol or cortisone have had undesirable side effects, like upset stomach, dizziness and loss of appetite, which shouldn't happen to a dog. What can be done? Homeopathic medicine, acupuncture, chiropractic and nutrition, say veterinarians who are committed to using alternative therapies in their practices.

headline.main: Acupuncture, Homeopathy And Chiropractic at the Vet's
